wiki.summary: "Sticker" is the title track of NCT 127's third studio album Sticker (2021). Produced by frequent production group and collaborator Dem Jointz, Calixthe, Prince Chapelle, Ryan S. Jhun and Yoo Young-jin with lyrical composition by the latter, member Taeyong and Mark, the "experimental" hip-hop track was released digitally on September 17, 2021 alongside an accompanying music video was released on the same release date, which depicts a "futuristic/space cowboy" concept. Read more on Last.fm.
wiki.content: "Sticker" is the title track of NCT 127's third studio album Sticker (2021). Produced by frequent production group and collaborator Dem Jointz, Calixthe, Prince Chapelle, Ryan S. Jhun and Yoo Young-jin with lyrical composition by the latter, member Taeyong and Mark, the "experimental" hip-hop track was released digitally on September 17, 2021 alongside an accompanying music video was released on the same release date, which depicts a "futuristic/space cowboy" concept. Following its release, "Sticker" received mixed to positive reviews from critics, citing its uniqueness for the group's signature "noisy" production, the flute melody throughout the song, and the members' vocals and rap. It also attained commercial native success, becoming the group's second top-five hit on the Gaon Digital Chart, while becoming their eleventh top-five entry on the Billboard's World Digital Songs. It also achieved ten wins in South Korean music programs, becoming the most-awarded song by NCT 127 and by an NCT sub-unit, and the first song by a boy group to achieve a music show all-kill since Wanna One's "Energetic" in 2017. It is also NCT 127's first entry on the Global 200 chart, peaking at number 101. Read more on Last.fm.
